page.title: 07Food In 1945
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 ___________________ Children would play in the middle of the street because of the lack of traffic.The year 1945 saw the begining of the Youth Clubs and in the summer they organized camps by the sea that you could visit.
Q.What food did they eat? I never had any Oranges, Bananas, Grapes or any other imported fruits till about six months after the war when a few Bananas came through. Oranges also filtered through. The only people who had them were pregnant women with green ration cards. Mothers were also allowed extra sugar ration for making jams. No icecream sometimes there was frozen fruit juices on sticks. Chicken was considered a luxury.
